div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, April 28, 1921

SECRETARY
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
April 28, 1921
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
We have received the following cable from
Doctor Hanson:

REPORTS FROM PACASMAYO TRUJILLO INDICATE
CASES FEVER STOP WILL INVESTIGATE AND ADVISE

Apparently Doctor Hanson has on his hands
a serious problem. Have you any suggestions as to
whether we ought to try to send an American, trained
in yellow fever work, to Doctor Hanson? If you think
this should be done have you any one to suggest who
would be available for such service?
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Doctor Henry R. Carter
2121 California Street N.W.
Washington, D. C.
WRR:HJW
